intro: Verticordia endlicheriana var. manicula, commonly known as the golden wattle or manikin's heart, is a member of the family Scrophulariaceae. It is native to the southwestern region of Western Australia, where it thrives in sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, heart-shaped leaves and striking yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is a low-growing shrub, typically reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
